args: Excuse me! I'm ready to order!
Excuse me! Is my order ready yet?
J-just about! I apologize for the wait!
*pant* Why are we so busy today? That\nshift was like wading through a minefield.

Ever since I got a cool breeze blowing
through here, the cafe's popularity
has soared. Which is a good thing,
mind you...
...but there is an upper limit to the\nnumber of customers I can handle!
Agreed. We can't handle a sustained rush\nlike this with just the two of us—and the\ncafe's reputation is at stake if we fail.
I refuse to let that happen. Is there nothing\nwe can do? Nowhere we can turn for help?
Looks like you're swamped.\nAre you hanging in there?
Is that the uniform here, Amane?\nIt's so cute!
Elias! Pia! What brings you two here?
Siren's going to be performing near here\ntomorrow, and we have tickets to see her.
But when we heard you were helping out\nat a restaurant in the area, we just HAD\nto stop by and visit!
Things seem pretty wild here, though.\nIs there anything we can do to help?
Those words are music to my ears—\nnot that I should be surprised,\ncoming from you!
You'd be doing us a huge favor.\nAmane, can I leave you in charge\nof giving them their tasks?
So, I would like the two of you to help\nby taking orders and serving the food.
If you run into any problems, call me\nand I'll work a little miracle for you!
Well, I HAVE been here longer than you.\nWill that work for you, too, Elias?
Sure thing. I'll go start taking orders now.
Great! And always remember: Our number\none goal is making our customers happy!
Now, while they're doing that, I need to\nset out the cutlery to get the tables ready.
She's run into trouble already?!\n*ahem* I'll be right there!
Amane, what should I do here? This man\nkeeps asking for something weird, and—
There is nothing ＂weird＂ about\nordering nostalgia noodles!
But sir, we don't have anything\nlike that on our menu.
Well, you should! Because if I can't\nhave what I came here for, then why\ndid I even make the trip? Hm?!
What should we do? We can't serve\nsomething we don't know how to make.\nMaybe we'd better just ask him to leave.
Absolutely not. What did I just tell\nyou about making our customers smile?
I mean, I didn't forget, but how are we—

We'll just have to try and work out how to
make the dish he wants. Fortunately,
interpersonal communication is one of
my many miraculous abilities.
Could you try and describe these\nnostalgia noodles for me, sir?
Where to start? It was a famous soba\ndish served at a restaurant in this very\nspot when I was a young lad.
I see. What did it taste like?\nWhat color was it?
It was a bowl of yellow soba noodles\ncovered in a spicy, sour black sauce.
Mm-hm. Did it contain anything\nother than noodles and sauce?
Let's see... There were vegetables that I\nseem to recall being either red or green...\nOh, plus a splendid omelet on top!
Understood. Please give us a moment.\nElias, Pia, I need you to come with me.
I'm going to make the dish he asked for,\nof course!
Elias, check on the noodles!\nAnd Pia, have you cut up the vegetables?
Y-yes! I've got a serving of green\nand red vegetables ready!
The noodles are boiled and good to go!\nWhat else is left?
Now I just need to add the\nsauce he asked for, and...done!\nI'll go and take it to him!
Thank you for waiting, sir! Here are\nthe nostalgia noodles you asked for!
I hope they're worth the wait.\n*munch* *munch* Oh my!
Oh, the memories are all flooding back...\nThis tastes exactly like I remember it!
I can't stop shoveling it down—it's like\nmy chopsticks have a life of their own!
Thank you kindly, young'uns. I am very\nsatisfied indeed. Here's what I owe you.
We're just glad to have made you happy!\nTake care, sir!
Amane, that was amazing! I can't believe\nyou made that stubborn old man smile!
But how were you able to recreate the\ndish he was talking about?
He said it was a soba dish, which\nimmediately made me think of Hinomoto.
So I thought back to what I learned about\nHinomotoan cuisine from the immigrants\nliving in my country.
I've got a great memory for stuff like that.\nEven so, I'm still glad I was able to\npull it off.
Ha ha. I've grown a lot\nsince I first came here!
There is no customer I cannot please!\nI trust I've earned your respect?
Ha ha. You've definitely got mine, too.\n...Hm?
Whoa, a dragon! Well, Amane, here's your\nchance to flex those customer service\nskills you're so proud of.
This will be no trouble. So long as it does\nnot seek to harm anyone, a dragon is a\ncustomer like any other. Let me just—
Urgh! ...It would seem I am not\nwelcome here.
I was hoping to sample the food of this\nwell-reputed restaurant in a land so dear\nto me... But I see it wasn't meant to be.
That's what we want to know. It's not\nlike you to suddenly attack a customer.
He... He reminded me of a\ndragon I wish I could forget.
The one who destroyed my homeland.\nThe second I saw him, my vision went\nwhite...
But that dragon is no more. The one who\ncame here just now has done nothing\nwrong...and yet I drove him away.
I am so ashamed of what I have done!
